articles.title: Joint Communique on Kim Yong Nam's Gambia Visit Issued
articles.content:
Joint Communique on Kim Yong Nam's Gambia Visit Issued
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- A joint communique on the official goodwill visit to the Republic of Gambia by Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, was made public in Banjul on April 3.
					 The communique said:
					
					 Kim Yong Nam, president of the SPA Presidium of the DPRK, paid an official goodwill visit to Gambia from April 1 to 3, 2010, at the invitation of Gambian President Yaya A.J.J. Jammeh.
					
					 During the visit, talks were held between Kim Yong Nam and Yaya A.J.J. Jammeh.
					
					 At the talks, they expressed the need to further consolidate the friendship and cooperation between the two countries.
					
					 They exchanged views on the political and economic situation in the Korean Peninsula, the African Continent and other regions of the world and had a discussion on ensuring peace and security as a precondition for the development.
					
					 They also expressed will to cooperate with each other in opposing all sorts of factors obstructive to peace, security and progress in the Korean Peninsula and the African Continent and affirmed that stability can not be achieved without peace.
					
					 They expressed the will to develop the South-South cooperation and cooperate with each other at the UN, the Non-Aligned Movement, the African Union and other international bodies.
					
					 They repeatedly stressed the need to respect the laws on global peace and security and provide justice and leniency.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam expressed thanks to the president, the government and the people of Gambia for their warm hospitality accorded during the visit and invited the Gambian president to visit the DPRK at an early date. The Gambian president accepted this invitation and it was decided to fix the period of his visit through diplomatic channel.

articles.title: DPRK, Gambia Sign Agreements
articles.content:
DPRK, Gambia Sign Agreements
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- An agreement on friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and the Republic of Gambia, an agreement on founding inter-governmental joint committee and an agreement on technical cooperation in various fields between the two countries were signed in Banjul.
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Myong San, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and Ri Kyong Son, DPRK ambassador to Gambia.
					
					Present from the opposite side were President Yaya A.J.J. Jammeh, Vice-President Aja Isatou Njie Saidy, General Secretary of the Presidential Office Mariama Khan, Minister of Fishery, Water Resources and Parliamentary Affairs Lamin Kaba Bajo and others.
					
					 The agreements were inked by President Kim Yong Nam, Kim Hyong Jun and Ri Myong San and President Yaya A.J.J. Jammeh and Ramin Kaba Bajo.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Thanks to Gambian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Thanks to Gambian President
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of thanks to Yaya A.J.J. Jammeh, president of Gambia, on Saturday, leaving Banjul after his official goodwill visit to Gambia.
					 In the message Kim Yong Nam expressed deep thanks to the Gambian president, government and people for their warm welcome and hospitality.
					
					 He also expressed satisfaction over the fact that the visit marked a significant occasion in deepening mutual understanding and friendship between the two peoples and boosting the relations between the two countries.
					
					 I was deeply impressed to see at first hand the admirable successes achieved by the Gambian people in the work for prosperity of the country, the message said.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam wished the friendly Gambian people fresh progress and welfare and the president of Gambia good health and success in his work.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Leaves Banjul
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Leaves Banjul
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday left Banjul after winding up his official goodwill visit to the Republic of Gambia.
					Kim Yong Nam and his party were seen off by Vice-President of Gambia Aja Isatou Njie Saidy, Speaker of the National Assembly Elizabeth Lenne, General Secretary of the Presidential Office Mariama Khan, Minister of Fishery, Water Resources and Parliamentary Affairs Lamin Kaba Bajo and other government ministers, military commanders and officials concerned of Gambia, diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations in Banjul.
					
					 A farewell ceremony took place at the airport.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Arrives in Dakar
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Arrives in Dakar
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Saturday arrived in Dakar to pay an official goodwill visit to the Republic of Sengal.
					 He was accompanied by Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Myong San, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and other suite members.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam and his party were greeted by Prime Minister of Sengal Souleymane Ndene Ndiaye, State Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs Becaye Diop, State Minister and Minister of Finance Abdoulaye Diop, State Minister and Minister of Armed Forces Balde, and other government officials and DPRK Ambassador to Senegal Ri Kyong Son.
					
					 A welcome ceremony for Kim Yong Nam took place at the airport.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Attends Unveiling Ceremony
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Attends Unveiling Ceremony
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on an official goodwill visit to Senegal, participated in the ceremony for unveiling the "Monument to Revival of Africa" on Saturday.
					 The monument represents in a formative artistic way the strong stamina and will of the African people to bring about their bright future by their own efforts while aspiring after independence and building of a new society. It has been successfully built in a short span of time with help of Korean technicians.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Senegalese President Abdoulaye Wade and heads of state and government from at least 20 African countries, representatives of different international and regional organizations, diplomatic envoys of different countries in Dakar and thousands of its citizens.
					
					 Incumbent and former presidents of African countries and representatives of international and regional organizations said at the ceremony that this wonderfully-built monument is pride of not only Senegal but also Africa. 
					
					 They expressed belief that the African people would make greater progress with the conviction of the future.

articles.title: S. Korean Army Fires Gun toward DPRK Post in DMZ
articles.content:
S. Korean Army Fires Gun toward DPRK Post in DMZ
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces committed grave armed provocation in the Demilitarized Zone in the eastern sector of the front on Sunday.
					 At about 14:07 that day the armed bandits of the puppet army intruded into the DMZ south of Marker No. 1270 of the Military Demarcation Line and fired 90 mm recoilless gun toward a civil police post of the north side, thus seriously threatening the safety of civil policemen of the north side on routine duty.
					
					 This was a premeditated provocation of the south Korean puppet forces designed to deliberately aggravate the situation in the DMZ of the MDL.
					
					 The touch-and-go situation was prevailing there owing to such undisguised military provocation committed under the eyes of the north.

articles.title: Hong Son Ok Urges Concluding Peace Treaty
articles.content:
Hong Son Ok Urges Concluding Peace Treaty
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- What is essential in ensuring peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and the region at present is to put an end to the hostile relations between the DPRK and the U.S.
					 Hong Son Ok, vice-chairperson of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly who is heading its delegation, stressed this on March 31 when speaking at the plenary meeting of the 122nd Conference of the Inter-Parliamentary Union.
					
					 To ensure peace and security comes up as the vital problem for the DPRK which could not but have access to nuclear weapons for the purpose of defending its sovereignty and the right to existence from the persistent nuclear threat of the U.S., she said, and went on:
					
					 The way for terminating the hostile relations between the DPRK and the U.S. based on long-standing distrust is to build confidence of each other by concluding a peace treaty between them.
					
					 The slow progress of the six-party talks, too, is due to the lack of confidence between the two countries.
					
					 With this lack of confidence the DPRK's satellite launch for peaceful purposes was called to task as "missile launch" and measure of sanctions taken to wantonly violate its sovereignty and, after all, it resulted in the nuclear test on the part of the DPRK as its self-defensive step.
					
					 The DPRK remains unchanged in its stand to provide a durable peacekeeping mechanism and realize the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula through dialogue and negotiation.
					
					 The DPRK, regarding independence, peace and friendship as the idea of its foreign policy, will as ever strive to build a peaceful and prosperous world, develop the good neighborly relations with other countries and realize global independence.
					
					 She expressed belief that the conscientious parliamentarians of the world speaking for justice would have a proper understanding of the present situation of the Korean Peninsula and continue to support the Korean people in the struggle for the national reunification and the regional peace and security, independent development and prosperity.

articles.title: Poster for Kimilsungia Festival Produced
articles.content:
Poster for Kimilsungia Festival Produced
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- A poster for the 12th Kimilsungia Festival to be held on the occasion of the Day of Sun has been produced.
					 Depicted in the center of the poster are beautiful Kimilsungia against the background of blue sky and the native home of President Kim Il Sung in Mangyongdae covered with flowers in full bloom.
					
					 Seen in the poster are letters reading "The 12th Kimilsungia Festival", the mark of the festival and the name of sponsor organization, the venue and period of the festival.
					
					 The poster reflects the unanimous desire of all people to hold the President in high esteem for all ages with the immortal flower.

articles.title: "Among the People" Vol. 86 Published
articles.content:
"Among the People" Vol. 86 Published
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House issued Vol. 86 of "Among the People", a collection of reminiscences.
					 Contained in the book are 19 reminiscences telling about the distinguished leadership, noble virtues and warm loving care of President Kim Il Sung who built Korea into the socialist power of Juche and devoted his all to the happiness of the people.
					
					 Reminiscences "Remembering the indelible traces left in Huichon" and "Calling for One More Demonstration of Kangson's Mettle" deal with the facts that the President visited Huichon and wisely led the construction of a base for the machine-building industry in the days of the hard-fought Fatherland Liberation War and guided the then Kangson Steel Works, the birthplace of the Chollima movement, to take the lead in the drive to attain the target of steel production for the fulfillment of the First Seven-Year Plan.
					
					 Among those reminiscences are "For the development of the nation's education" telling about the leadership feats of the President who showed deep care for the education of the rising generations and "Unforgettable Chilgol in spring" dealing with the fact that he called for inheriting the noble patriotic soul and spirit cherished by his revolutionary family members while recalling with deep emotion the career of his mother Kang Pan Sok.
					
					 There are also reminiscences telling that the President worked heart and soul for the agricultural development of the country and led officials to fully discharge their duty as a faithful servant of the people and reminiscences elaborating on his personality as the great man who led the same life with that of the common people all his life while showing boundless love for the revolutionary comrades and people.

articles.title: US-S. Korea War Moves against DPRK Blasted
articles.content:
US-S. Korea War Moves against DPRK Blasted
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the commander of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces in south Korea contended, talking about possible "contingency" in the DPRK, that measures and preparedness for military intervention are needed to cope with it. The warlike forces of the south Korean military, too, are getting unprecedentedly hell-bent on the military provocative moves against the DPRK.
					 Commenting on the facts, Minju Joson Sunday says:
					
					 The remark about "contingency" itself is a deliberate provocation to the DPRK, and it represents the U.S. stand to invade the DPRK by force.
					
					 The U.S. is now going beyond the danger line in the moves to provoke a war for aggression on the DPRK. It has already worked out such anti-DPRK war scenarios as "OPLAN 5029", the keynote of which is to intentionally create war situation through "massive offensive of pressure" in case of "contingency" in the DPRK and spark off military conflict. At present it is frantically trying to put the scenarios into practice.
					
					 What is intolerable is that the south Korean conservative group is persistently joining in the U.S. moves to provoke a war for aggression on the DPRK.
					
					 "Dialogue" and "improvement of relations" touted by the United States and the south Korean conservative group are noting but a deception to cover up their design to invade the DPRK, and they are recklessly seeking only to ignite a war for aggression on the DPRK.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK do not want war but love peace. However, should the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers unleash a war for aggression on the DPRK, they will deal a mercilessly annihilating strike at them and the provokers will be bound to face a lot of forlorn wandering spirits.

articles.title: Japan's Scheme to Grab Tok Islets Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Japan's Scheme to Grab Tok Islets Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- The Youth and Students Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration called a press conference in Seoul on April 1, denouncing Japan for its ambition for grabbing Tok Islets.
					 At the press conference speakers charged that the Japanese government recently made a provocative attempt to seize Tok Islets again while getting hell-bent on discrimination moves against the Korean schools in Japan.
					
					 Recalling that the government of Japan decided to mark Tok Islets as part of its territory even in textbook for primary schools and passed its examination, they denounced this behavior as a wanton violation of the dignity and sovereignty of the Korean nation.
					
					 They held that Japan should reflect on and make reparation for its past crimes and abandon its ambition for "dominium" over Tok Islets at once.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should take a strong action against Japan's moves for grabbing the islets, they urged, declaring that they would provide a decisive occasion to liquidate the Japanese imperialists' crimes of aggression this year.

articles.title: Dismantlement of Weapons Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Dismantlement of Weapons Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, the Inhabitants' Measure Committee against the Expansion of Mugon-ri Drill Ground and other anti-war peace organizations in south Korea held the 99th rally for peace and disarmament in Seoul on March 30.
					 At the rally speakers disclosed the fact that the U.S. forces have stockpiled many lethal weapons in south Korea as reserves for a war.
					
					 Exposing the danger of weapons of mass destruction the U.S. has kept for a war of aggression on the DPRK, they denounced the U.S. for having unhesitatingly used napalm and germ bombs during the last Korean War.
					
					 Intolerable is the possession of lethal weapons that take lives of many people, they said, demanding that the U.S. forces withdraw from south Korea at an early date, taking along with their lethal weapons.

articles.title: Withdrawal of Discrimination against Korean Schools Urged
articles.content:
Withdrawal of Discrimination against Korean Schools Urged
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Officials of Korean schools, students and their parents and members of civic organizations of Japan called an emergency press conference in Tokyo on April 1 in protest against the Japanese authorities' unreasonable discriminative measure against the Korean schools.
					 At the press conference Sin Kil Ung, principal of Tokyo Korean Senior High School, Choe In Thae, principal of Ibaragi Korean Junior High School, and other speakers referred to the fact that the draft bill on supporting high schools, which essentially excludes the Korean schools only from tuition-free program for senior high schools, was passed at the full-dress session of Japan's House of Councilors on Mar. 31 and came into force on April 1.
					
					 They said that this unreasonable action of the Japanese government is touching off the resentment of the Korean students, their parents and all other Korean residents in Japan.
					
					 Lurking behind the action is the Japanese authorities' politically motivated intention, they pointed out, stressing that such unjust discriminative behavior can never be pardoned.
					
					 Japanese personages also made speeches at the conference.
					
					 Mamoru Sonobe, secretary general of the Association for Supporting Korean Academy in Kanagawa, said that it is very regrettable that only the Korean schools were excluded from the said program, which is as good as an act of making distinction among the foreign schools.
					
					 Kiyoshi Nisijawa, vice-chairperson of the Japan-Korea Society for Scientific and Educational Interchange, contended that the Japanese government should apologize for exposing the students of Korean schools to distress and include those schools in the program.
					
					 In the meantime Kim Sun On, managing director of Tokyo Korean Academy, issued a statement demanding the withdrawal of the Japanese authorities' unreasonable discriminative step on the same day.

articles.title: Important Days in April Marked
articles.content:
Important Days in April Marked
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held in France, Guinea and by the Secretariat of the Pan-African Movement and film shows in Russia, Thailand, Malaysia, Ethiopia and by the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea between Mar. 23 and 26 on the occasions of the Day of the Sun, the 17th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and the 78th anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
					 The chief of the French Group for the Study of Juche and Songun Idea said at a seminar that President Kim Il Sung made the victorious history of the Korean revolution by founding the Juche idea, the Songun idea, and his exploits would shine long with prosperous socialist Korea.
					
					 The chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea at the Kankan University of Guinea referred to the significance of the seminar on Kim Jong Il's work "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution", saying: Thanks to the Songun politics, the revolutionary armed forces have been remarkably strengthened, the defence lines of the country fortified as firm as rock and great changes brought about in the revolution and construction in the DPRK.
					
					The executive secretary of the Secretariat of the Pan-African Movement hoped that the DPRK would continue to fully demonstrate its dignity as the invincible power under the wise leadership of 
						Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar in France.
					
					 Appreciated at the film shows were such Korean films as "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation", "Arms of the DPRK" and "The Country I Saw".

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Russia
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "For a Free and Peaceful New World" was brought out in booklet by a printing house in Vladivostok of Russia on March 29.
					 Clearly expounded in the work, published on April 29, Juche 80 (1991), are the tasks and ways for building a new world desired by the mankind.

articles.title: Mexican Institute Publishes Bulletin
articles.content:
Mexican Institute Publishes Bulletin
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea published the 53rd issue of its bulletin to mark the 17th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and the 78th anniversary of the founding of the Korean People's Army.
					 The bulletin carried a photo of Kim Jong Il inspecting a KPA unit.
					
					 In an article titled "Chairman of NDC Kim Jong Il and Invincible KPA" it stressed that his election as NDC chairman marked an important occasion in making the KPA further demonstrate its might as an invincible army.
					
					 Thanks to him, the politico-ideological and military technical might of the KPA has been strengthened in every way, the bulletin said, and went on:
					
					 He has steadily taken measures to equip the army with unique strategy and tactics as required by modern warfare and in conformity with the geographical features of the country and strengthen its military technical preparedness.
					
					 Today the KPA is an invincible army equipped with nuclear deterrent and prepared both for attack and defence. 
					
					 The KPA holding Kim Jong Il as NDC chairman will fully demonstrate its might of invincibility in the future, too.
